channel.title: Cheap Video Cards
channel.description:
Recently I've been on the look out for a new(cheap) video card. I've never been one for the high end gaming, so I don't want to fork out for something that a cheaper alternative can manage. I have a desktop PC with 1Gb RAM. I have managed to narrow down into two/three choices, although the one card has two types of connections.
[url=http://www.play.com/PC/PCs/4-/3326322/Sapphire-Radeon-X1650-Pro-AGP-512MB-Graphics-Card/Product.html]Sapphire Radeon X1650 PRO[/url] [url=http://www.play.com/PC/PCs/4-/3514319/Sapphire-Radeon-HD-2600Pro-512MB-AGP-Graphics-Card/Product.html]Sapphire Radeon HD 2600Pro - AGP[/url] [url=http://www.play.com/PC/PCs/4-/3432185/Sapphire-Radeon-HD-2600Pro-512MB-PCI-E-Graphics-Card/Product.html]Sapphire Radeon HD 2600Pro - PCI-E[/url]
Any thoughts? Computer hardware isn't really my strong point, so any help will suffice.

item.title: Cheap Video Cards
item.dc:creator: @Baros_Rocks Baros Rocks
item.description:
@Baros_Rocks wrote:

Recently I’ve been on the look out for a new(cheap) video card. I’ve never been one for the high end gaming, so I don’t want to fork out for something that a cheaper alternative can manage. I have a desktop PC with 1Gb RAM. I have managed to narrow down into two/three choices, although the one card has two types of connections.

Sapphire Radeon X1650 PRO
Sapphire Radeon HD 2600Pro - AGP
Sapphire Radeon HD 2600Pro - PCI-E

Any thoughts? Computer hardware isn’t really my strong point, so any help will suffice.

Read full topic
